==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=もろこしきび}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=もろこしきび|唐|tr1=morokoshi|t1=China in general; {{qualifier|by extension}} foreign|黍|tr2=kibi|t2=millet}}.

The spelling is from {{etyl|zh|-}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> See ''shokusho'' below.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|もろこし きび|acc=5}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|唐黍}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|もろこし きび}}

# [[sorghum]]

=====Usage notes=====
The longer term ''morokoshi kibi'' has been largely replaced by the shorter form ''morokoshi'' below.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|蜀黍|もろこし}}, {{ja-r|唐黍|もろこし}}
* {{ja-r|唐黍|とうきび}}
* {{ja-r|高黍|たかきび}}

===Etymology 2===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|モロコシ|蜀黍}}
{{wikipedia|Sorghum bicolor}}
[[File:Sorghum.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|蜀黍}} (''morokoshi kibi'', ''morokoshi'', ''shokusho''): '''[[sorghum]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=もろこし}}
Abbreviation of ''morokoshi kibi'' above, with the abbreviated reading then re-applied to the entire kanji compound.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|もろこし|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|唐黍}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|もろこし}}

# [[sorghum]]
# [[maize]], [[corn]] {{qualifier|especially [[corn on the cob]]}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|sorghum}} {{ja-r|蜀黍|もろこし}}, {{ja-r|唐黍|もろこし}}, {{ja-r|唐黍|とうきび}}, {{ja-r|高黍|たかきび}}
* {{sense|maize}} {{ja-r|玉蜀黍|とうもろこし}}, {{ja-r|唐黍|とうきび}}

=====Usage notes=====
The term {{m|ja|玉蜀黍|tr=tōmorokoshi}} is more common for the {{m|en|maize}} sense.

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|しょく|しょ}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょくしょ}} compound {{m|zh|蜀黍|tr=dzyowk syo<sup>X</sup>|lit=Shu (old place name) + millet}}. The ancient [[w:Shu (state)|state of Shu]] is roughly analogous to modern [[w:Sichuan|Sichuan]] province.

This reading appears to be rare, and may be obsolete.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|しょくしょ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しょくしょ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しょくしょ|rare|possibly|_|obsolete}} [[sorghum]]
